ParentCompanyName: KD Acquisition 1 LLC., DBA Kings Delight

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RISK MANAGEMENT SUBMISSION STATEMENT

Coleman Natural Foods / Kings Delight
Facilities #9 & #4
1155 Candler Road
Gainesville, GA. 30507

This plan is to inform all interested persons, including employees of Coleman Natural Foods / Kings Delight Facilities #9 and #4 that we are complying with EPAA?s Risk Management Program Title 40 CFR Part 68. We vow to promote a safe environment for our facilities, employees and the public. By implementing this program it enables our facilities to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences of significant releases, fires and or explosions from anhydrous ammonia. Our PSM program provides guidelines, procedures, and practices which help governs individual processes, activities, and equipment. These guidelines are reviewed as necessary. They are also communicated to and accepted by employees at the facilities involved in the covered process.

Description of  Process

The Southeastern Freezer (#9), and Kings Delight #4 are cold storage, and poultry processing facilities. They use anhydrous ammonia in an industrial refrigeration system to maintain temperatures in three cold storage freezers and one spiral freezer. The refrigeration system also has 7 blast cells for freezing. In the poultry processing facility the anhydrous ammonia is used to maintain temperatures in the processing areas. There are a total of twenty-three ACUs. There are four systems on site having a total of 59,000 lbs. of anhydrous ammonia. The facility maintains a full time refrigeration maintenance staff that conducts multiple service inspections on a daily basis. In addition there is a computer control system that monitors temperatures, pressures, and the atmosphere for leaks. Any irregular condition will result in the activation of an automated paging system to contact refrigeration personnel. 

Accident History

There have been no reportable releases in the past five years.

Emergency Response Program

The facilityA?s emergency response program is ba

sed on the OSHA requirements for Emergency Action Plans (29 CFR 1910.38 and 1910.119)  
This plan is coordinated with the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) and the local Fire Department. We conduct annual drills for implementation of the Emergency Response Plan at the facility with the anticipation of participation from the LEPC and the Fire Department. The last update of the facilityA?s Emergency Response Plan was on October 6, 2008.
